metadata.title: CVE-2018-18503 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
When JavaScript is used to create and manipulate an audio buffer, apotentially exploitable crash may occur because of a compartment mismatchin some situations. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 65.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18503` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 65.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 65.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 65.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 65.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '65.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
